element.name: Road Racing by Windsockers, Multi-cache (3.5/1.5)

long-description.p: The Skerries 100, is one of Irelands most famous motorcycle road race.

Skerries village is just north of Dublin, and has been associated with road racing since the 1930’s, when the Leinster 100, was run on a 21 km circuit which linked the villages of Skerries, Lusk and Rush.

From 1935 there was no racing at Skerries for ten years, as the Leinster races moved to the Taillight course, but when war-time difficulties prevented the Dublin and Districts annual 100 mile road race from running at Phoenix Park, so the Skerries 100 was born.

The first race took place on July 6th 1946, around a 12 km course with the start/finish on Skerries Main Street! Harry Turner from Belfast won the inaugural Skerries 100 and since then all of Irelands top road racers have raced at Skerries. In the 1970’s there were battles between Tom Herron, Joey Dunlop, Conor McGinn and Ray McCullough. the 1980’s had racers like Eddie Laycock, Phillip McCallen, Steve Cull and Robert Dunlop and the most popular of all, Bangor's Sam McClements, who rode at Skerries for an amazing 21 Years.
The present 4.5 km circuit may seem small in comparison to the 12km Skerries track, but it is no less demanding, with a record lap speed of 170 kph set by Mr WJ Dunlop MBE, OBE.

The Skerries 100 attracts thousands of regular visitors from overseas, many make the annual ‘pilgrimage’ to North County Dublin to enjoy the renowned hospitality of the area and watch pure road racing at its very best amidst some of the best scenery in the County. Over 30,000 spectators are expected to attend the event each year.
To find the cache you will need to follow the circuit of the road race and obtain some information along the way

At the above coordinates you will find the missing part of the coordinates for the next stage.
N53 33.--- W6 08.---

Note the initials of this person here and using ABC=123etc convert them to number form and call them X.Y.Z
Go to N53 33.(Z-6)51 W6 0(Y-X+Z-6) .1(Z-6)7

Note the first phone number here call it A.B.C.D.E.F.G
The numbers may also be needed for the final location
Go to N53 33.B (D+E) (C-B) W6 0(G+D).(A-F) (A-E) (E-E)

Note the numbers here S.T.U.V.W.X.Y.Z
Go to N53 33.V2(V+W) W6 0(U+Z). (U+Z)Z (U+W)

Using ABC=123 etc convert the numbers and call them A.B.C.D.E.F.G.H.I.
Go to N53 33.(A-2)F(E-F) W6 07.(A-2) 7(B-A)

Note the number here this will be needed for the final location
Go to N53 34.011 W6 07.551

Note several sweet numbers across the road and use the first digit. this will be needed for the final location
Go to N53 33.986 W6 08.138

Note the numbers here call them A.B.C.D.E.F.G
Go to N53 33.C(C-B) 5 W6 0A. (E+G-F) 5B
Here you will find some of the missing coordinates for the final location

X= answer from stage 6
Y=answer from stage 7
N53 ??.XX? W6 ??.?Y?

ul.li:
2009-06-03T19:00:00Z : Found it by auchans
Well we found one! Mary found it as Joe was still aching from his last find--LOL Took Teddy Bear and left Auchans button and MardiGras World Coin. T.F.T.C.

2008-11-21T20:00:00Z : Owner Maintenance by Windsockers
Maintenance visit all stages ok

2008-08-19T19:00:00Z : Found it by theswerve
Found 6 this time ok after a hint from owner and bit of head scratching...good multi for the bikers..

2008-08-17T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by theswerve
Got to infamous stage 9 easy enough...damn it,i looked and looked..could not find it!

2008-08-02T19:00:00Z : Found it by parkmoy
All I will say is that this cache has a lot of stages! Found during an assault on Windsockerland. TFTC.

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Road Racing
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The Skerries 100, is one of Irelands most famous motorcycle road race.

Skerries village is just north of Dublin, and has been associated with road racing since the 1930’s, when the Leinster 100, was run on a 21 km circuit which linked the villages of Skerries, Lusk and Rush.

From 1935 there was no racing at Skerries for ten years, as the Leinster races moved to the Taillight course, but when war-time difficulties prevented the Dublin and Districts annual 100 mile road race from running at Phoenix Park, so the Skerries 100 was born.

The first race took place on July 6th 1946, around a 12 km course with the start/finish on Skerries Main Street! Harry Turner from Belfast won the inaugural Skerries 100 and since then all of Irelands top road racers have raced at Skerries. In the 1970’s there were battles between Tom Herron, Joey Dunlop, Conor McGinn and Ray McCullough. the 1980’s had racers like Eddie Laycock, Phillip McCallen, Steve Cull and Robert Dunlop and the most popular of all, Bangor's Sam McClements, who rode at Skerries for an amazing 21 Years.

The present 4.5 km circuit may seem small in comparison to the 12km Skerries track, but it is no less demanding, with a record lap speed of 170 kph set by Mr WJ Dunlop MBE, OBE.

The Skerries 100 attracts thousands of regular visitors from overseas, many make the annual ‘pilgrimage’ to North County Dublin to enjoy the renowned hospitality of the area and watch pure road racing at its very best amidst some of the best scenery in the County. Over 30,000 spectators are expected to attend the event each year.

The Cache

To find the cache you will need to follow the circuit of the road race and obtain some information along the way

Start/finish:

N53 33.878 W6 08.603

At the above coordinates you will find the missing part of the coordinates for the next stage.
N53 33.--- W6 08.---

Stage Two: Dublin Corner

Note the initials of this person here and using ABC=123etc convert them to number form and call them X.Y.Z
Go to N53 33.(Z-6)51 W6 0(Y-X+Z-6) .1(Z-6)7

Stage Three: Dukes Bends

Note the first phone number here call it A.B.C.D.E.F.G
The numbers may also be needed for the final location
Go to N53 33.B (D+E) (C-B) W6 0(G+D).(A-F) (A-E) (E-E)


Stage Four: Baldongan Cross

Note the numbers here S.T.U.V.W.X.Y.Z
Go to N53 33.V2(V+W) W6 0(U+Z). (U+Z)Z (U+W)

Stage Five: Glasshouse Road

Using ABC=123 etc convert the numbers and call them A.B.C.D.E.F.G.H.I.
Go to N53 33.(A-2)F(E-F) W6 07.(A-2) 7(B-A)

Stage Six: Gillies Leap

Note the number here this will be needed for the final location
Go to N53 34.011 W6 07.551

Stage Seven; Shady lane

Note several sweet numbers across the road and use the first digit. this will be needed for the final location
Go to N53 33.986 W6 08.138

Stage Eight: Sam’s Tunnel

Note the numbers here call them A.B.C.D.E.F.G
Go to N53 33.C(C-B) 5 W6 0A. (E+G-F) 5B

Stage Nine: Chicane

Here you will find some of the missing coordinates for the final location

Final Location

X= answer from stage 6
Y=answer from stage 7
N53 ??.XX? W6 ??.?Y?




The Windsockers
